noun.description: The quality of being easy to mold, cut, compress, or fold.
examples: I snuggled deeper into the warm softness of my bed
the hardness of the steel contrasted with the softness of the wax

noun.description: A subtle effect or contrast; lack of sharp definition.
examples: the graininess and softness of the picture are the primary flaws

noun.description: The quality of being sympathetic, lenient, or compassionate.
examples: he recommended conciliation and softness towards national minorities

noun.description: The degree to which water is free from mineral salts that make lathering difficult.
examples: a glass-care program regulates the water softness
